alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hampden; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Windham, Tolland, southeastern Hartford, south central Worcester and southeastern Hampden Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glastonbury to near East Haddam. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, hail up to penny size and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Glastonbury, Vernon, Mansfield, Windham, Willimantic, Killingly, Southbridge, Ellington, Tolland, Coventry, Stafford, Dudley, Hebron, Putnam, Thompson, Sturbridge, Brooklyn, Woodstock and Marlborough. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
